title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint
The paper suggests the method to visualize 4D compositional data on a 2D canvas. This can be used to visualize data such as posterior model probabilities for 4 models on (2D) paper without loss of information and distortion. My contributions are general polishing of manuscript, creating 3D interactive figures and animation, and development of R package (planned).

title: Projects
text:
R package “metabmc”
The package implements meta-uncertainty quantification for Bayesian model comparison. This can be used to evaluate trustworthiness of posterior model probabilities, which tend to take extreme values. Check the project website for more detail. The development is still in progress and will be published in near future.

title: Projects
section: R package for Bayesian proxy structural VAR
text:
R package for Bayesian proxy structural VAR
The package implements Bayesian vector autoregressive model with proxy variables for structural shocks in economy. This can help agents like government and central bank to make decisions, considering the expected effects in the system of economy. The development is still in progress and will be published in near future.

title: 疋田 悠河
text:
疋田 悠河
フィンランドで機械学習博士課程。主にベイズ統計学/機械学習に興味があります。


来歴
2025- 博士研究員 @アアルト大学PMLグループ  シミュレーションに基づく統計的推論、尤度フリー推論
2023-2024 リサーチアシスタント @ドルトムント工科大学統計学部  Rパッケージの開発、償却推論
2021-2023 DSインターン @Rejoui  ログデータを使った顧客の行動解析、医療分野のテキストマイニング



興味
ベイズ統計学  ベイズ実験計画  シミュレーションに基づく統計的推論  償却推論  尤度フリー推論


教育

2025-2028 機械学習博士   アアルト大学, フィンランド 
2022-2024 計量経済学修士   ドルトムント工科大学, ドイツ 
2018-2022 経済学学士   サセックス大学, イギリス 




詳しい情報は英語ページをご覧ください。
プロジェクト一覧  履歴書  コンタクト

title: Yuga Hikida
text:
Bluesky
  
  
    
     Email
  

  
  
From 2025, I will be a doctoral researcher in the Probabilistic Machine Learning group at Aalto University, working on compute-efficient and robust simulation-based inference with Ayush Bharti.
Prior to that, I was a master student in Econometrics at TU Dortmund University, where I worked as a research assistant on the development of R packages for Bayesian model comparison (with Marvin Schmitt) and Bayesian vector autoregression (with Jan Prüser), and wrote thesis on amortized Bayesian experimental design under the supervision of Marvin Schmitt, Desi Ivanova, and Paul Bürkner.
Click here to see my CV.



Interests
Bayesian Statistics  Bayesian Experimental Design  Simulation-based Inference  Amortized Inference  Likelihood-free Inference


Education

PhD in Statistical Machine Learning Aalto University, Finland, 2025-2028
MSc in Econometrics TU Dortmund, Germany, 2022-2024
BSc in Economics University of Sussex, UK, 2018-2022
